caption: Table 1: Quantitative results on Google Scanned Objects dataset.
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of the proposed Direct3D model against several state-of-the-art image-to-3D generation methods on the Google Scanned Objects (GSO) dataset.  The metrics used for comparison include Chamfer Distance (lower is better), Volume IoU (higher is better), and F-Score (higher is better). The results demonstrate the superior performance of Direct3D in terms of generating high-quality 3D models.

caption: Table 2: User study on the quality of meshes. The higher the score, ranging from 1 to 5, the better.
description: This table presents the results of a user study that evaluated the quality and consistency of 3D meshes generated by different methods.  Users rated the meshes on a scale of 1 to 5, with higher scores indicating better quality and consistency.  The methods compared include Shap-E, One-2-3-45, Michelangelo, InstantMesh, and the authors' proposed method (Ours).  The table shows that the authors' method achieved significantly higher scores for both quality and consistency, indicating that their approach generates superior 3D models.

caption: Table 3: Quantitative comparisons of reconstruction with different latent representations on Objaverse evaluation set.
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of 3D shape reconstruction results using two different latent space representations: an implicit 1D space (Shape2VecSet) and an explicit triplane (the authors' method).  The comparison is based on the Objaverse evaluation set and uses three metrics: Chamfer Distance (lower is better), Volume IoU (higher is better), and F-Score (higher is better).  The results demonstrate the superior performance of the explicit triplane representation in accurately reconstructing 3D shapes.

caption: Table 4: Quantitative results of semi-continuous surface sampling strategy.
description: This table presents a quantitative comparison of the model's performance using different sampling strategies during training. It shows the Chamfer Distance, Volume IoU, and F-Score metrics for models trained with and without a semi-continuous surface sampling strategy. The results demonstrate the effectiveness of the semi-continuous sampling strategy in improving reconstruction quality.
